availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William C. Marshall (Bracken County, Kentucky, attorney and Ky state rep)

body.p: Bracken County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Kentucky native. Son of M. Marshall and M. B. Marshall. Married to Susan Myers Marshall in Bracken County on October 7, 1834. Father of Mary Marshall, Elizabeth Marshall, Thomas Marshall, Martin Marshall, William Marshall, George Marshall, Matilda Marshall, Robert Marshall, Margaret Marshall, and Charles Marshall. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Bracken County from 1834 to 1835, 1840 to 1843, 1844 to 1845, and 1850 to 1851. Member of the Convention for the Revision of the Constitution of the State of Kentucky representing Bracken County in 1849. Attorney in Bracken County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Bracken County in 1850. Attorney in Bracken County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Bracken County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, p. 451B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, p. 639.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Eastern District, p. 138.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, Eastern District, p. 173B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bracken County Marriages, Film #000344097, p. 267 of 403 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Report of the Debates and Proceedings of the Convention for the Revision of the Constitution of the State of Kentucky (Frankfort, KY: A. G. Hodges, 1849), 6.
Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1874), 772.
Find A Grave, "William Champe Marshall (1807-1869)," Memorial # 94139625, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/94139625/william-champe-marshall (accessed June 18, 2018).
